intro: Gerascanthus lasiocalyx, commonly known as the rough-hairy geranium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to red, bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gerascanthus lasiocalyx is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
